Judul: KNOWLEDGE & BEHAVIOR ANALYSIS OF GASTRITIS SELF-MEDICATION AMONG UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS BATCH 2018 IN INSTITUT TEKNOLOGI BANDUNG
Abstrak:
Prevalence of gastritis in Indonesia is high particularly among university students. Although gastritis
can be managed with self-medication, it is often performed incorrectly. This study was designed to
investigate the knowledge and behavior of gastritis self-medication among undergraduate
students batch 2018 in Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB), who are currently in the final year of their
study. This research was conducted using a self-developed questionnaire. The questionnaire was
validated and then sent to undergraduate students batch 2018 in ITB who had experienced
gastritis symptoms and willing to fill in the questionnaire. The total respondent was 271. Overall,

NSAID as one of the risk factors of gastritis had a relatively high number of wrong answers
compared to others. The answers for questions regarding behavior were dominated by strongly
agree (80%), indicating good behavior in gastritis self-medication. Gender and the faculty of the
students (pharmacy vs. non-pharmacy) may influence the level of knowledge. Whereas for
behavior, there was no influence of sociodemographic background. In conclusion, knowledge and
behavior of undergraduate students, batch 2018 in ITB regarding gastritis self- medication were
good. However, the knowledge and behavior can be improved for certain issues such as risk of
gastritis due to NSAID use and performed education targeted to male students who had relatively
lower knowledge compared to women.
